business.headline: Why salaried Indians need a personal finance reset in 2026Rising living costs, changing job patterns and sweeping labour law reforms are urging salaried Indians to rethink how secure their finances really are.

Ban gig work and you don't solve inequality: Eternal CEO Deepinder GoyalEternal founder Deepinder Goyal argued that the gig economy debate is less about wages and more about discomfort with inequality, warning that bans and over-regulation could erase livelihoods instead of fixing systemic gaps.
Sensex closes 573 points higher, Nifty hits fresh high; NTPC up 5%The S&P BSE Sensex added 573.41 points to close at 85,762.01, while the Nifty50 jumped 182 points to end at 26,328.55​​​​​​​.

Cigarettes to cost more from February 1. Here's how new rates will be decidedThe new levies on tobacco and pan masala will be imposed over and above the applicable GST rates. These measures will replace the GST compensation cess, which is currently charged at varying rates on sin products.

Missed the revised ITR filing deadline? Know what happens to tax refundIn most cases, refunds are issued within a few weeks to a few months. Delays may occur due to mismatches in TDS details, bank account validation issues, or cases selected for scrutiny.

ITC shares tumble 4%, down 13% in 2 days: Buy the dip or stay away?The sharp sell-off comes after the finance ministry revised the taxation structure for cigarettes, effective February 1, 2026. Here is all you need to know.

MCX shares crash 80% in early deals, but the fall is not what it seemsMCX shares fell by more than 80% on trading screens on Friday, hitting an intraday low of Rs 2,192 on the BSE. This was compared with Thursday's closing price of Rs 10,988.60.

Devyani International and Sapphire Foods India shares in focus. Here's whyDevyani International shares were trading at Rs 152.80, up Rs 5.37 or 3.64% during the morning session as of 9:39 am. In contrast, Sapphire Foods India shares were trading lower at Rs 253.95, down Rs 8.75 or 3.33%.

Sensex, Nifty open higher driven by auto, metal stocks as FMCG continues to fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was up 172.34 points to 85,360.94, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 44.10 points to 26,190.65 as of 9:26 am.

Gold, silver price today: How have precious metals started 2026?Gold and silver prices moved higher on Friday, recovering part of the losses seen late last week, even as investors looked back at the historic gains these metals delivered through 2025.

Is 10-minute delivery really unsafe? Zomato CEO answers after gig workers strikeWhile delivery services on platforms such as Zomato and Blinkit were largely unaffected on New Year's Eve, questions around whether 10-minute delivery models put pressure on riders gained traction on social media.

If system was unfair...: Deepinder Goyal as Zomato unaffected by gig workers' strikeZomato and its quick-commerce arm Blinkit recorded their highest-ever single-day orders on New Year's Eve, delivering over 75 lakh orders despite a nationwide gig workers' strike. Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said such scale shows a system seen as unfair cannot consistently attract or retain workers.

Special Report: India's Economy Faces Trump Tariffs and Trade Impasse Entering 2026In this Special Report, an unidentified speaker analyses the state of the Indian economy as the nation steps into 2026. While highlighting a 'stupendous 2025' marked by major reforms like GST simplification and the Jan Vishwas Bill, the report warns that India enters the new year 'playing on a strong economic pitch, but also on a sticky wicket'. Key challenges identified include the ongoing trade impasse with the US, punitive 'Trump tariffs' of 50%, and a depreciating rupee which breached the 91 mark against the dollar. The programme notes that while GDP growth remains robust at 8%, high food inflation and sluggish job creation persist. With five state elections due in 2026, the report also flags concerns over rising state debts due to populist spending, even as all eyes turn to the upcoming Union Budget in February to restore confidence and boost private investment.

Commercial LPG cylinder price hiked by Rs 111 on New Year, highest since June 2025On New Year's Day, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by Rs 111 — the steepest hike in six months, — with effect from today. The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder, however, remains unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty end lower as ITC, Godfrey Phillipss crash on tobacco cess moveThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 32 points to close at 85,188.60, while the NSE Nifty50 was up by 16.95 points to end at 26,146.55.

Silver vs gold vs stock vs real estate: What can deliver most gains in 2026Should it be gold, which has just seen its strongest year since 1979? Or silver, which has surged over 150%, marking one of its best-ever annual performances?

Inside draft labour code rules. What the fine print says on wages, working hoursThe draft Rules relate to the Code on Wages, the Code on Social Security, the Industrial Relations Code and the Code on Occupational Safety, Health and Working Conditions.

ITC, Godfrey Phillips shares tank up to 16%: Why are tobacco shares falling todayShares of Godfrey Phillips India Ltd fell sharply in early trade, sliding nearly 16%. Shares of ITC Ltd also came under pressure, falling around 9% during early trade. The stock slipped to about Rs 362.70, touching its 52-week low.
Sensex opens 180 points higher, Nifty above 26,150; ITC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 104.21 points to 85,324.81, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 28.60 points to 26,158.20 as of 9:25 am.

Stock market holiday today? Check if NSE and BSE are closed for New Year 2026Major international stock markets across China, Hong Kong, Japan, Singapore, France, Germany, the UAE, the UK and the US are closed on New Year's Day.

entertainment.headline: 7 Malayalam films to watch in 2026: From bold experiments to star power  From inventive genre experiments to long-awaited star collaborations, Malayalam cinema's 2026 slate reflects an industry confident enough to let ideas lead before scale follows.

Thalaivar173: Rajinikanth joins Cibi Chakravarty's next, Pongal 2027 release set Cibi Chakravarty has been confirmed as the director for Thalaivar 173, following the departure of Sundar C due to creative disagreements. The announcement brings the Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan collaboration back on track, with a targeted Pongal 2027 release.

Why Bollywood is trading chocolate boys for macho heroes in 2026 As Bollywood moves past chocolate boy charm, macho heroes dominate 2025 hits and the 2026 lineup. In Cinematic Saturday this week, we look at why the audiences are craving grit over sweetness.

Thottam: Keerthy Suresh goes gritty in new poster of her next dark action thriller The makers of the upcoming Malayalam action-thriller Thottam have released a striking new poster, featuring Keerthy Suresh and Antony Varghese. Shooting for the film is set to begin in early 2026.

Amitabh Bachchan says goodbye to KBC 17, leaves viewers teary-eyed. Watch promo The final episode of Kaun Banega Crorepati Season 17 sees Amitabh Bachchan reflecting on his journey, expressing heartfelt thanks to viewers, and delivering a record-breaking musical performance.

Bollywood bets big on patriotism again despite recent setbacks. Will it pay off? Bollywood's patriotic films struggled at the box office in 2025 despite familiar themes. Upcoming releases and OTT series aim to revive interest with fresh storytelling and scale.

Dhurandhar box office Day 29: Ranveer film sees its 1st major dip after dream run Ranveer Singh's spy thriller Dhurandhar has seen a slight dip in its box office collections after an impressive four-week run. The film continues to hold strong occupancy and is poised for a weekend rebound.

Ikkis box office Day 2: Agastya Nanda's war drama sees dip, earns Rs 10.5 crore Sriram Raghavan's war drama Ikkis, starring Agastya Nanda and Dharmendra in his final role, opened with strong reviews and decent first-day numbers, but saw collections fall on day two amid tough competition from other releases.

Actor Tommy Lee Jones' daughter Victoria Jones found dead in San Francisco hotel Victoria Jones, 34, daughter of actor Tommy Lee Jones, was found dead in a San Francisco hotel, police said. Authorities have termed the death non-suspicious, with the Medical Examiner probing the cause.

A decade in Hawkins: Why letting go of Stranger Things is so hard Stranger Things signs off, leaving viewers with a deep sense of homesickness. By turning the 80s into a shared emotional language, the show closes not just a chapter in Hawkins, but one in our own lives.

Chatha Pacha locks January 22 release, poster hints at Mammootty connection The wrestling-based Malayalam action entertainer has locked its theatrical release date, with a new poster subtly hinting at a possible Mammootty association.

Sunny Deol shares story of father Dharmendra inspiring him to do Border. Video Sunny Deol shared personal insights at the launch of Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2, detailing how his father's film Haqeeqat influenced his career and the making of the Border series. The event, held at Longewala–Tanot, featured emotional moments and tributes to the military.

Mera dimaag thoda hila hua hai: Emotional Sunny Deol at Border 2 song launch At the unveiling of Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2, Sunny Deol expresses strong emotions alongside the armed forces at Longewala–Tanot sector, with the event highlighting respect and remembrance for his legacy.

Ahan Shetty touches Sunny Deol's feet at Border 2 song launch. Watch video The launch of the song 'Ghar Kab Aaoge' from the film Border 2 took place at the historic Longewala–Tanot landscape in Jaisalmer, bringing together armed forces personnel and the film's cast and crew in a show of respect and national pride.

Border 2: Sunny Deol reignites patriotic nostalgia in Ghar Kab Aaoge Border 2 makers unveiled the reimagined song Ghar Kab Aaoge in Jaisalmer. The soulful tribute honours Indian soldiers while connecting legacy with modern voices.

Nicole Kidman looks forward in post ringing in 2026 amid divorce with Keith Urban Nicole Kidman shared a message about "looking forward", while ringing in 2026 with her daughters. She recently separated from Keith Urban after 20 years of marriage.

Shark Tank India Season 5: Full judges list, new faces and returns The fifth season of Shark Tank India launches on January 5, 2026, introducing a refreshed panel of judges comprising both established entrepreneurs and new faces from diverse sectors.

Battle of Galwan leak? Viral Salman Khan war clip turns out to be AI Amid heightened anticipation of Battle of Galwan, a video claiming to be a scene from the Salman Khan starrer has gone viral. However, here's the catch. The video is not real.

Stranger Things' Karen Wheeler welcomes 2026 with bestie Vecna Actress Cara Buono shared a light-hearted photograph with co-star Jamie Campbell Bower, dressed as Vecna, to welcome 2026 and offer fans a look behind the scenes after the release of the Stranger Things finale on Netflix.

general news.headline: IPL 2026: BCCI asks KKR to release Bangladesh cricketer Mustafizur RahmanIPL 2026: BCCI has asked Kolkata Knight Riders to release Mustafizur Rahman from their IPL 2026 squad. The decision follows recent developments, with the board also allowing KKR to sign a replacement if needed.

6-year-old girl gangraped, thrown from terrace in UP; accused shot in encounterA six-year-old girl was gang-raped and murdered in Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh, after being thrown from a rooftop, police said.

Over 12 Maoists killed in encounter in Chhattisgarh's SukmaAt least 12 Naxalites, including a senior area committee leader, were killed in an encounter with security forces in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district, with automatic weapons recovered from the site.

Degree in hand, RDX in pocket: Rajnath Singh flags white-collar terror threatSpeaking at an event in Udapipur, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh warned that rising "white-collar terrorism" showed education without ethics can be deadly, citing the Red Fort car bomb blast, where three doctors were arrested.

Time, Tide & Tamil Part 10 | Gods, Kings & Grammar: Sangam's Shift from Sacred to SecularWhat concerns us here is not geography or geology, but grammar — how a civilisation understood itself before it theologised itself.

Deadly Swiss resort fire likely sparked by Bengal lights: InvestigatorsA devastating New Year's Eve fire at a bar in Switzerland's Crans-Montana ski resort, likely sparked by Bengal lights on champagne bottles.
Seeing without eyes? Inside Blindsight, Musk's boldest 2026 projectNeuralink's Blindsight implant has received FDA breakthrough status, aiming to restore sight by stimulating the visual cortex.

No votes cast, Mahayuti wins 68 seats unopposed in Maharashtra civic pollsNomination withdrawals across Maharashtra's civic bodies handed the BJP-led Mahayuti 68 unopposed wins, including 44 for the BJP, ahead of municipal polls scheduled for January 15.

Why Bollywood is trading chocolate boys for macho heroes in 2026As Bollywood moves past chocolate boy charm, macho heroes dominate 2025 hits and the 2026 lineup. In Cinematic Saturday this week, we look at why the audiences are craving grit over sweetness.

Germany's student deportation scare exposes India's overseas education blind spotGermany was supposed to be the safe choice. Affordable, regulated and predictable, it was marketed in India as a refuge from the tightening visa regimes of the United States and the UK. That belief is now being tested as Indian students enroled in certain private university programmes face the prospect of deportation. The episode has exposed a question India has long sidestepped.

Bihari girls ready for marriage at Rs 25,000: BJP Minister's husband sparks rowIn the viral video, Girdhari Lal Sahu can be heard addressing an event and allegedly saying, "Will you get married in old age? If you are unable to get married, we will bring a girl for you from Bihar".

FBI foils IS-inspired New Year's Eve attack in North Carolina, teen arrestedUS authorities said that 18-year-old Christian Sturdivant from North Carolina was arrested days before New Year's Eve after the FBI uncovered an Islamic State-inspired terror plan to carry out a mass-casualty attack.

Why festivals make family–partner dynamics feel more complicatedDo you often feel a quiet tension with your partner or family during the festive season? The urge to juggle everything perfectly doesn't always come without stress. Sometimes, the festivals themselves are to blame.

Drunk man climbs Tirupati's Govindarajaswamy Temple, demands alcohol to come downA drunk man triggered panic at the Sri Govindarajaswamy Temple in Tirupati after climbing the gopuram and reaching the kalashas, demanding alcohol to come down.

Live: Tehran urges UN to condemn Trump's 'reckless, provocative' warningsAnti-Khamenei Protests live updates: At the funerals of protesters who died in security forces' crackdown, chants of "Death to Khamenei" and "Shah will return" echo as unrest across Iran enters seventh day. Protests over the deteriorating economy turned violent across at least 50 cities, including the Shia clerical stronghold of Qom. At least eight people were killed amid clashes with the regime's security forces. US President Donald Trump warned Iran against targeting demonstrators.

Bollywood bets big on patriotism again despite recent setbacks. Will it pay off?Bollywood's patriotic films struggled at the box office in 2025 despite familiar themes. Upcoming releases and OTT series aim to revive interest with fresh storytelling and scale.

Gaganyaan, PSLV, SSLV private debut: Isro's big 2026 plans revealedIsro is set to dominate the 2026 space calendar with several high-profile launches including the robotic pioneer Vyommitra. From the Gaganyaan trials to electric satellites, India is redefining the cost of innovation.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

The seed that gave Coca-Cola its name, and the bitter story behind itThe kola nut, once a sacred West African symbol of respect and unity, became part of Coca-Cola's original formula. Its journey from ritual ingredient to global brand reveals a deeper story of colonial extraction, ecological strain, and how capitalism transforms cultural treasures into commodities without giving back.

Sachin Tendulkar's Perth heroics: Cracks as wide as a bat didn't scare the 18-year-oldAmid the testing conditions at the WACA in 1992, Sachin Tendulkar announced himself on the world stage with a composed 114, standing up to Australia's fearsome pace attack on a pitch known for its pace and uneven bounce. Former teammate Pravin Amre later recalled the innings as a rare exhibition of temperament and technique from an 18-year-old, underlining how that knock set Tendulkar apart so early in his career.

Italy comes to India: The hill station designed like a European townA planned city which is also a hill station near Pune is called the 'Italy of India' for its deliberate European‑inspired design. Its pastel façades, lakeside promenade and walkable boulevards echo the charm of Italian towns.

Seamingly forgotten: Why India shouldn't move on from Mohammed Shami yetMohammed Shami has spent his career making the ball talk; now, his domestic numbers are screaming. To ignore him today isn't just a selection choice—it's a refusal to acknowledge that India's best, in one-day internationals, is still standing.

Why is China making condoms, birth control pills expensive?China has removed tax exemptions on condoms and contraceptive pills, making them more expensive as part of a broader push to reverse falling birth rates and a rapidly ageing population. But what's behind the desperation for babies and why now?

sports.headline: BCCI arm-twisted into removing Bangladesh's Mustafizur Rahman from IPL: Madan Lal Former India cricketer Madan Lal has stated that sports should not be mixed with politics, reacting to the BCCI's request for KKR to release Bangladesh pacer Mustafizur Rahman from their squad ahead of the 2026 Indian Premier League season.

Shubman Gill misses Punjab's Vijay Hazare Trophy game due to food poisoning India captain Shubman Gill missed Punjab's Vijay Hazare Trophy match due to food poisoning. His condition is minor, and he is expected to play in the upcoming New Zealand ODI series.

IPL 2026: BCCI asks KKR to release Bangladesh cricketer Mustafizur Rahman IPL 2026: BCCI has asked Kolkata Knight Riders to release Mustafizur Rahman from their IPL 2026 squad. The decision follows recent developments, with the board also allowing KKR to sign a replacement if needed.

Shreyas Iyer cleared to play Vijay Hazare: Can India star make IND vs NZ ODI squad? Shreyas Iyer has taken a crucial step towards his comeback by returning to Vijay Hazare action. But with India's ODI squad for New Zealand imminent, timing and fitness may decide his immediate international return.

Peter Siddle in T20 World Cup 2026 plans? Ex-bowler backs seamer as reserve option Jason Gillespie has endorsed Peter Siddle for a potential comeback in the T20 World Cup 2026. The veteran seamer's current form in the Big Bash League makes him a viable backup option despite his age and long absence, feels Gilespie.

Men's Hockey India League 2026: Bengal Tigers out to defend crown but face stiff test The men's Hero Hockey India League is all set to start off with Shrachi Bengal Tigers aiming to defend their crown. However, they will have their work cut out with seven teams aiming to claim the crown for themselves.

Steve Smith backs Usman Khawaja's stance against injury criticism: It was unfair Steve Smith has defended Usman Khawaja against criticism over his injury setback during the Ashes. The stand-in captain called the scrutiny of Khawaja's preparation unfair as the opener approaches retirement.

Seamingly forgotten: Why India shouldn't move on from Mohammed Shami yet Mohammed Shami has spent his career making the ball talk; now, his domestic numbers are screaming. To ignore him today isn't just a selection choice—it's a refusal to acknowledge that India's best, in one-day internationals, is still standing.

Pep Guardiola shuts Manchester City exit talks yet again: I know you're bored of me Pep Guardiola has once again dismissed exit rumours, insisting he will honour his Manchester City contract. With the title race heating up, the Spaniard remains focused on leading City through a crucial phase of the season.

India squad announcement live: Team to be unveiled in afternoon, confirms Saikia India vs New Zealand 2026 ODI squad announcement live updates: The BCCI is all set to release the squad for the three-match ODI series against New Zealand beginning on January 11. There have been questions about Rishabh Pant's place amid Ishan Kishan's rise.

Shah Rukh Khan, Mustafizur IPL controversy: Kaif asks BCCI to make right call Bollywood actor Shah Rukh Khan's co-owned IPL franchise Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) has landed in controversy after signing Bangladesh player Mustafizur Rahman at the IPL mini auction. Mohammad Kaif has backed BCCI to take the right call on the matter.

Ben Stokes is the best England captain: Zak Crawley defends forgetful Ashes outingZak Crawley has backed Ben Stokes to remain England's Test captain beyond the Ashes setback. Despite series defeat, players continue to trust Stokes' leadership and believe stability is key for England's red-ball future.

Harmanpreet Singh 2.0? SG Pipers' Rohit eyes deadly dragflick battery with India captainSpeaking in an exclusive interaction with India Today, young dragflicker Rohit comments on his admiration for idol Harmanpreet Singh, his goals with SG Pipers in the upcoming Hockey India League season and aspirations of being a regular in the Indian senior team.

Joao Cancelo becomes strong January transfer target for Barcelona, Inter MilanJoao Cancelo's January future hangs in balance as Barcelona hesitate and Inter push hard. Frozen out at Al Hilal, the full-back awaits a decisive call that could shape his season in Europe's elite leagues again.

Sachin Tendulkar's Perth heroics: Cracks as wide as a bat didn't scare the 18-year-oldAmid the testing conditions at the WACA in 1992, Sachin Tendulkar announced himself on the world stage with a composed 114, standing up to Australia's fearsome pace attack on a pitch known for its pace and uneven bounce. Former teammate Pravin Amre later recalled the innings as a rare exhibition of temperament and technique from an 18-year-old, underlining how that knock set Tendulkar apart so early in his career.

BCCI to announce ODI squad today, Rishabh Pant's white-ball fate in focusAll eyes are on the Indian team and the BCCI, as they begin 2026 with the three-match ODI series against New Zealand. While the side may have been firing, there are still plenty of questions regarding some of the names that could face the axe, or get picked in the squad.

Shubman Gill back in VHT: Will he move on from T20 World Cup snub?Following his snub from India's T20 World Cup squad, Shubman Gill is all set to make his return to the field as he will step out for Punjab during the Vijay Hazare Trophy on Saturday, January 3.

BCCI reject IND vs SL charity game in December: Sri Lanka cricket chairmanSri Lanka Cricket has revealed that BCCI has rejected their proposal for a charity game in December between India and Sri Lanka for victims affected by Cyclone Ditwah.

Shah Rukh Khan, KKR face BJP leader's threat: If any Bangladeshi plays…The inclusion of Bangladeshi fast bowler Mustafizur Rahman in Kolkata Knight Riders for the 2026 IPL season has sparked sharp reactions from political and religious leaders, raising concerns about the participation of foreign players amid regional tensions.

Cremer returns as Zimbabwe reveal Raza-led T20 World Cup 2026 squadFormer captain Graeme Cremer returns to Zimbabwe's squad for the 2026 T20 World Cup, joining a side led by Sikandar Raza and featuring a blend of experience and recent performers. Zimbabwe will open their group campaign against Oman in Sri Lanka.

Shubman Gill's Vijay Hazare Trophy game vs Sikkim not open to general public: ReportShubman Gill's Punjab match against Sikkim will be played without spectators at Jaipuria College ground. This decision follows security concerns and lack of seating arrangements, impacting live coverage and fan access.

Sunil Chhetri leads Indian players' video appeal to FIFA amid ongoing football crisisSunil Chhetri and the Indian players have made a last-ditch video appeal to FIFA amidst the ongoing football crisis in the country. The Indian Super League, which was supposed to start in September, is yet to get underway, causing uncertainty amongst the teams and players.

Haris Rauf taken to the cleaners as Melbourne Stars suffer first loss in BBL 2025-26Haris Rauf endured a tough night at the Gabba as Brisbane Heat chased down 196, with Max Bryant leading a late assault that handed Melbourne Stars their first loss of the BBL season.

Nick Kyrgios, Aryna Sabalenka down for Battle of the Sexes rematch despite backlashNick Kyrgios and Aryna Sabalenka reflect on the controversial 'Battle of the Sexes' exhibition, addressing criticism and calling for renewed competition.

Despite Ashes flopshow, Ben Stokes wants Brendon McCullum to stay on as coachBen Stokes affirms his support for Brendon McCullum as England faces scrutiny following the Ashes series, with internal reviews focusing on team culture and coaching structure. Stokes feels that McCullum is the right man to take the team forward.

Only two Indians in World Athletics' top anti-doping testing listOnly two Indian athletes — Neeraj Chopra and Sachin Yadav — have been named in World Athletics' anti-doping Registered Testing Pool for early 2026, even as India has led global doping violations for three consecutive years.

South Africa drop Tristan Stubbs, Ryan Rickelton from 15-man T20 World Cup squadAiden Markram will lead South Africa at the ICC Men's T20 World Cup, with the squad also featuring Quinton de Kock, who recently came out of international retirement, and Anrich Nortje, who has returned to action following his recovery from injury.

India to play additional T20Is in Sri Lanka to aid cyclone-hit regions: ReportSri Lanka Cricket (SLC) Chairman Shammi Silva has claimed the BCCI has agreed to add T20Is to India's August 2026 tour of Sri Lanka to support relief and reconstruction efforts after Cyclone Ditwah.

Usman Khawaja's racial stereotyping allegations questioned by Australian legendAustralian legend Jason Gillespie questioned Usman Khawaja's claims of racial stereotyping. Khawaja claimed that he was personally attacked by pundits and the media for suffering an injury during the Perth Test.

Washington Sundar denies photos and autographs, fans question his attitude: WatchWashington Sundar sparked debate online after a video showed him avoiding fan requests for photos and autographs. While some criticised his attitude, others defended him, citing privacy and discomfort.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
